title: [$500] Web - Bank Account - User is signed out when clicking 'Update to USD'

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

comments.body: Triggered auto assignment to @jliexpensify (`Bug`), see https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/14418 for more details.

### Bug0 Triage Checklist ([Main S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418))

- [ ] This "bug" occurs on a supported platform (ensure `Platforms` in OP are ✅)
- [ ] This bug is not a duplicate report (check [E/App issues](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues) and [#expensify-bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM))
    - If it is, comment with a link to the original report, close the issue and add any novel details to the original issue instead
- [ ] This bug is reproducible using the reproduction steps in the OP. [S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418#:~:text=The%20bug%20is%20reproducible)
    - If the reproduction steps are clear and you're unable to reproduce the bug, check with the reporter and QA first, then close the issue.
    - If the reproduction steps aren't clear and you determine the correct steps, please update the OP.
- [ ] This issue is filled out as thoroughly and clearly as possible
    - Pay special attention to the title, results, platforms where the bug occurs, and if the bug happens on staging/production.
- [ ] I have reviewed and subscribed to the linked Slack conversation to ensure Slack/Github stay in sync
Triggered auto assignment to Contributor-plus team member for initial proposal review - @Ollyws (`External`)
Hey, i've investigated the issue and the error says your session is timed out and application goes back to login page because no auth token is passed in the API request.

📣 @rahyabahmed! 📣
Hey, it seems we don’t have your contributor details yet! You'll only have to do this once, and this is how we'll hire you on Upwork.
Please follow these steps:
1. Make sure you've read and understood the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md).
2. Get the email address used to login to your Expensify account. If you don't already have an Expensify account, create one [here](https://new.expensify.com/). If you have multiple accounts (e.g. one for testing), please use your main account email.
3. Get the link to your Upwork profile. It's necessary because we only pay via Upwork. You can access it by logging in, and then clicking on your name. It'll look like [this](https://www.upwork.com/freelancers/~01ca8ad8ce36b9eceb). If you don't already have an account, sign up for one [here](https://www.upwork.com/nx/signup/?dest=home).
4. Copy the format below and paste it in a comment on this issue. Replace the placeholder text with your actual details.
![Screen Shot 2022-11-16 at 4 42 54 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30609178/231263719-a8a3b7d3-36a0-4d7f-8ad4-cebe1f560fa4.png)
Format:
```
Contributor details
Your Expensify account email: <REPLACE EMAIL HERE>
Upwork Profile Link: <REPLACE LINK HERE>
```

Proposal
Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue.
Users are being signed out of the application when they attempt to update their workspace currency to USD.

What is the root cause of that problem?
The root cause of the problem is not entirely clear without further investigation, but it appears to be related to the currency update process. It may involve the confirmCurrencyChangeAndHideModal function or the useEffect hook in WorkspaceInitialPage.js, which could be inadvertently affecting the user's session state when the currency is updated.

What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem?
We should investigate the functions related to the currency update process to ensure they are not causing side effects that would sign a user out. This includes reviewing the Policy.updateGeneralSettings and ReimbursementAccount.navigateToBankAccountRoute functions called within confirmCurrencyChangeAndHideModal, as well as the useEffect hook that listens to changes in policy.outputCurrency. We need to ensure that these functions and hooks are not interfering with authentication and session management.

What alternative solutions did you explore? (Optional)
An alternative solution could be to add logging around the currency update process to capture more detailed information about the user's session state before and after the update to USD is attempted. This would help in identifying the exact point at which the sign-out occurs and could provide insights into whether the issue is with the currency update logic itself or with session management elsewhere in the application.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 1.4.3.2 **Reproducible in staging?:** y **Reproducible in production?:** **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team **Slack conversation:** ## Action Performed: Precondition: The workspace's initial preferred currency should be a currency other than USD 1. Open a tab where user A is signed in 2. Click on 'Search' icon > click on 'Refer a friend' > click on 'Copy referral link' button 3. Open a separate window > paste the link in address bar > press enter 4. Click on 'Email' > enter email in input field > click on 'Next' button > click on 'Join' 5. Click on 'New workspace' 6. Navigate to Profile settings > click on 'Contact method' > click on your email 7. Click on 'Didn't receive a magic code?' link > copy magic code from email > paste the magic code in the input field 8. Navigate to 'Workspace' setting 9. Click the workspace you have created > click on 'Bank account' > click on 'Update to USD' button ## Expected Result: Workspace currency should be updated to USD and user shouldn't be signed out ## Actual Result: User is signed out ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Which of our officially supported platforms is this issue occurring on? - [ ] Android: Native - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: Native - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos Add any screenshot/video evidence https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/93399543/424ab731-12f1-4c24-bb76-1565f82de0a5 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit
  • Upwork Job URL: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~0144d9542a7d9bfe6c
  • Upwork Job ID: 1728152407220977664
  • Last Price Increase: 2023-11-24
